Package main

Class MainController

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.WindowAdapter
      • main.MainController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.WindowFocusListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.event.WindowStateListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.InternalFrameListener, IWebSocketListener
    public class MainController
extends java.awt.event.WindowAdapter
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, IWebSocketListener, javax.swing.event.InternalFrameListener
    An instance of this class controls the interactions between the major program components: preferences, watchlist and charts.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MainController​(javax.swing.JDialog preferencesDialog, StockFinderDialog stockFinderDialog, WatchlistFrame watchlist, IWatchlistModel watchlistModel, ApplicationPreferencesModel preferences, IPreferencesPersistence persistence, MainFrame mainFrame, MainMenuBar mainMenuBar)
      Constructs the main controller, establishes a connection to the active data provider on program start and restores both watchlist and charts from persistent storage.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Handles events from the user interacting with the "Preferences", "Stock Finder", "Watchlist" and "Exit" buttons on the main menu bar, as well as the buttons within the watchlist frame and the stock finder.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainController

        public MainController​(javax.swing.JDialog preferencesDialog,
                      StockFinderDialog stockFinderDialog,
                      WatchlistFrame watchlist,
                      IWatchlistModel watchlistModel,
                      ApplicationPreferencesModel preferences,
                      IPreferencesPersistence persistence,
                      MainFrame mainFrame,
                      MainMenuBar mainMenuBar)
        Constructs the main controller, establishes a connection to the active data provider on program start and restores both watchlist and charts from persistent storage.
        Parameters:
        preferencesDialog - the preferences dialog
        stockFinderDialog - the stock finder dialog
        watchlist - the watchlist
        watchlistModel - the watchlist model
        preferences - the preferences model
        persistence - an object that provides methods to persistenly store application preferences
        mainFrame - the main frame
        mainMenuBar - the main menu bar

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Handles events from the user interacting with the "Preferences", "Stock Finder", "Watchlist" and "Exit" buttons on the main menu bar, as well as the buttons within the watchlist frame and the stock finder.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • processWebSocketTradeMessage

        public void processWebSocketTradeMessage​(java.lang.String message)
        Process trade messages received from the data provider through the web socket connection. The message gets parsed and prices in the watchlist and the charts updated accordingly.
        Specified by:
        processWebSocketTradeMessage in interface IWebSocketListener
        Parameters:
        message - the trade message in JSON format

      • windowClosing

        public void windowClosing​(java.awt.event.WindowEvent e)
        Called when the user closes the main frame. Stores data to be persisted in the preferences model and exits the application.
        Specified by:
        windowClosing in interface java.awt.event.WindowListener
        Overrides:
        windowClosing in class java.awt.event.WindowAdapter

      • internalFrameClosed

        public void internalFrameClosed​(javax.swing.event.InternalFrameEvent e)
        Called when the user closes a chart frame. Removes that chart frame from the chart frame map.
        Specified by:
        internalFrameClosed in interface javax.swing.event.InternalFrameListener
